items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
	 
In December 2013, the District received a grant of $56.9 million from the California Community Colleges Chancellor's Office to lead the Online Education Initiative (OEI) for the System.  The District selected the Butte-Glenn Community College District as its primary partner for the project.  In July of 2014, the Board of Trustees approved the subaward contract between the District and the Butte-Glenn District for years 1 (2013/14) and 2 (2014/15) of the OEI project.
	This amendment to the OEI subaward to the Butte-Glenn Community College District covers year 3 (2015/16) of the OEI project.  The amendment extends the original terms of the subaward agreement and details the year 3 budget.
	 
Submitted by:
 Joe Moreau, Vice Chancellor, Technology, x6120
Additional contact names:
					 
Is backup provided?
 Yes
items.item_recommendation: Vice Chancellor Joe Moreau recommends the approval of the Online Education Initiative Subaward Agreement Amendment between Foothill-De Anza Community College District and Butte-Glenn Community College District.
items.item_text: Subaward Agreement Amendment between Foothill-De Anza Community College District and Butte-Glenn Community College District
items.item_text_raw: 3. Subaward Agreement Amendment between Foothill-De Anza Community College District and Butte-Glenn Community College District

items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
	 
The purpose of a Valley Transportation Authority (VTA) EcoPass agreement is to provide annual transit passes to all eligible students of Foothill-De Anza Community College District. 
	 
At the De Anza College Student Body election on May 15, 2011, a majority of students agreed that the Foothill De Anza Community College District Board of Trustees should take action to charge a mandatory quarterly fee of up to five dollars to all full-time De Anza College students and a mandatory quarterly prorated fee to all De Anza College part-time students to make VTA EcoPasses available to all De Anza students. On June 20, 2011, the Board of Trustees passed a resolution implementing the mandatory transportation fee effective fall quarter 2011 at De Anza College.
	 
At the Foothill Student Body election January 28-31, 2013, a majority of students agreed that the Foothill-De Anza Community College District Board of Trustees should take action to charge a mandatory quarterly fee of up to five dollars to all full-time Foothill College students and a mandatory prorated fee to all Foothill College part-time students to make a VTA EcoPass available to all students.  On March 11, 2013, the Board of Trustees passed a resolution implementing the mandatory fee. 
	 
Board approval is requested for the 2015-2016 VTA EcoPass contract for an estimated amount of $342,000.
	 
Submitted by:
Brian Murphy, President De Anza College, ext 8705 &  Kimberlee Messina, Interim President, Foothill College x7200
Additional contact names:
Susan Cheu, VP Finance ext 8976 & Bernata Slater VP,  Finance & Admin Services ext 7364
Is backup provided?
Yes
items.item_recommendation: De Anza College President and Foothill College Interim President recommend approval of the VTA EcoPass contract
items.item_text: Valley Transportation Authority Contract for the De Anza College and Foothill College EcoPass Program 2015-2016
items.item_text_raw: 4. Valley Transportation Authority Contract for the De Anza College and Foothill College EcoPass Program 2015-2016

Foothill College seeks board approval for curriculum additions and changes for the 2016-17 Catalog. Per Title 5 direction, all course changes, substantial and non-substantial, must be approved by the governing board of the District before they may be submitted to the State Chancellor's Office for final approval.
	 
These courses have met Foothill’s curriculum standards and the Foothill College Curriculum Committee certifies that they are compliant with Title 5 regulations.

items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
	 
The Foothill College Biology and Health Sciences department made a request to purchase a high fidelity patient simulator, to be used collaboratively by the Paramedic/EMT, Radiologic Technologies, and Respiratory Therapy programs. This valuable simulation equipment will allow participation in interdisciplinary training and simulation scenarios to better prepare students for clinical practice. Additionally this equipment will be used independently for laboratory exercises and competency training. 
	 
The District Purchasing Services Department prepared bid documents and incorporated technical specifications jointly written with Foothill College staff for the purchase of the Patient Simulation System for the Foothill Biology and Health Program.  
	 
Invitation to Bid (ITB) #1736 was advertised in the San Jose Post Record on August 7, 2015 and August 11, 2015.  The ITB was posted through the FHDA portal on PlanetBids website.  Purchasing Services staff opened the bids on August 31, 2015 at 2 PM. One bid was received from Laerdal Medical Corporation in the amount of $104,973.54.
	 
As provided in the bid instructions, the award will be made to the responsive and responsible bidder who offered the lowest grand total on the bid forms. The lowest responsive and responsible bidder is Laerdal Medical Corporation. 
	 
The equipment will be funded by the CTE Enhancement Grant and is within the amount budgeted for this purchase.
	 
 
 Submitted by:
Pam Grey, Director of Purchasing Services
Additional contact names:
Dr. Nanette Solvason, Dean, Biological and Health Sciences, Annette Perez, Sr. Buyer
Is backup provided?
items.item_recommendation: Authorize the Director of Purchasing Services to issue a purchase order to Laerdal Medical Corporation in the amount of $104,973.54 in accordance with Bid 1736.
items.item_text: Foothill College - Award a contract pursuant to Invitation to Bid 1736 - Patient Simulation System
items.item_text_raw: 6. Foothill College - Award a contract pursuant to Invitation to Bid 1736 - Patient Simulation System

items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
	 
As a companion to our Educational Master Plan 2015-2020, Foothill proposes working with M. Arthur Gensler Jr. & Associates to develop the college's Facilities Master Plan 2017-2022.
	 
The purpose of the Facilities Master Plan is to provide a guide for future campus maintenance and renovation. The plan will describe how the College will be improved to meet the educational mission, serve the changing needs of our students and address the future requirements of the campus.
	 
Foothill's participatory governance groups (PaRC, Academic  Senate, and Classified Senate) will guide this collaborative process. We anticipate the planning, development and production of the plan will span the 2015-2016 academic year.
	 
Board approval is requested for the contract with M. Arthur Gensler Jr. & Associates Inc. for the term of September 1, 2015 to June 30, 2016 in the amount of $90,000.
	 
Submitted by:
Kimberlee Messina, Interim President, Foothill College
Additional contact names:
Bernata Slater
Is backup provided?
Yes (Corrected attachment posted 9/11/15 8:42 a.m.)
items.item_recommendation: The Foothill College administration recommends approval of the contract with M. Arthur Gensler Jr. & Associates, Inc. for developing the Facilities Master Plan.
items.item_text: Foothill College - Contract with M. Arthur Gensler Jr. & Associates, Inc. for Developing the Facilities Master Plan
items.item_text_raw: 7. Foothill College - Contract with M. Arthur Gensler Jr. & Associates, Inc. for Developing the Facilities Master Plan

Background and Analysis:
	 
As a companion to our Educational Master Plan 2015-2020, De Anza College proposes working with M. Arthur Gensler Jr. & Associates to develop the College’s Facilities Master Plan 2017-2022.
	 
The purpose of the Facilities Master Plan is to provide a guide for future campus maintenance and development. The plan will describe how the College will be improved to meet the educational mission, serve the changing needs of our students and address the future requirements of the campus.
	 
The De Anza College Facilities committee, a college participatory governance group, will lead this collaborative process. We anticipate the planning; development and production will span the 2015-16 academic year.

items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
	 
As required under Title 5, Section 58301, the Board held a public hearing on the 2015-16 fiscal year budget at their meeting on August 31, 2015. Vice Chancellor Kevin McElroy reviewed the budget document. This was an informational presentation and no action was taken. There were no changes made to the proposed budget at the August 31, 2015, meeting.
	 
Consistent with the requirements of Title 5, Section 58305, which requires that on or before the 15th day of September, the governing board of each district shall adopt a final budget, we recommend that the Foothill-De Anza Community College District Board of Trustees adopt the 2015-16 budget as presented.
	 
Submitted by:
 Kevin McElroy, Vice Chancellor, Business Services, x6202
Additional contact names:
 Hector Quinonez, Executive Director, Fiscal Services, x6250
 Joni Hayes, Director, Budget Operations, x6261
Is backup provided?
 Yes
items.item_recommendation: Vice Chancellor of Business Services Kevin McElroy recommends adoption of the 2015-16 budget.

items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
 
Title: Prime Contract Change Order #11
Vendor: DL Falk Construction
Agreement Date: August 4, 2014
Campus: De Anza College
Project Number: 216
Project Name:  Library
Amount: $74,051
For: 
	 
Prime Contract Change Order #11 - revises the original contract sum between the District and D.L. Falk Construction - to improve facility performance, increase ease of maintainability, or to address discovered conditions.
	 
	 
PCO 068 COR #66 CCD #21 Paint walls @ Rm 102 thru 105 & 205 thru 209 and the lobby columns and bands (OD)
PCO 069 COR #69 RFI#211 Door Frame Modifications were required for tile finish to be achieved as required per drawings (install ½” layer of wood, fill and paint at two locations (ADDC)
PCO 074 COR #73 & 75 - Paint Shotcrete Walls and all other locations throughout the building that have the concrete tan walls, columns and bands (OD)
PCO 075 COR #74 RFI#249 T Bar Connections at Concrete – Installation of specified T-bar wires did not attach to substrate correctly. Contractor was required to use an alternate installation method (FC)
PCO 078 COR#78 RFI#234 Roof Drain Location – Condensate drains require relocation as existing conditions do not allow for the proper slope (FC)
PCO 079 COR #58.1 RFI#221 & 177.1 Box Lights – Original detailed installation did not achieve the required attachment, therefore additional details were required (ADDC)
PCO 080 COR #81 RFI 160 2nd Floor Ceilings – Room 209 & 215 had high, sloped ceilings. T-Bar ceiling was required to be installed (ADDC)
PCO 081 COR #82 RFI 241 Light vs Access Panels – In seven rooms there is a conflict with the new ceiling lights and existing access doors.  Electrical is required to be moved. (ADDC)
PCO 085 – There shall be a five (5) calendar day non-compensable project schedule extension for work associated with PCO#75.
	 
The total Change Orders to date represent 16.68% against the original contract amount.  Funding is included in the construction budget.
	 
Submitted by:
Steve Kitchen, Executive Director, Facilities and Operations
Additional contact names:
Donna Jones Dulin, Associate Vice President - College Operations
Tom Armstrong, Director - Bond Program Management at De Anza College
					Steve Kitchen, Executive Director - Facilities and Operations
Is backup provided?
Yes

items.item_text_raw: B) DL Falk Construction - Prime Contract Change Order #11 - Library - $74,051

items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
 
Title: Change No. 2 to Agreement for Services
Vendor: Noll & Tam, Architects and Planners
Agreement Date: 04/06/2015
Campus: De Anza College
Project Number: 275
Project Name:  L7 Phase II
Amount: $136,155
For: 
	 
This additional service request is for Phase II Construction Administration (CA) activities including submittal review; RFI’s; CCD’s generated by Contractor RFI’s and unforeseen conditions; OAC meetings; topic-specific contractor meetings regarding construction; punch lists; and closeout. The approximate construction schedule for Phase II is represented by the attached schedule, provided by the District. Phase I CA for the classrooms and base building will be complete by September 15. CA activities for Phase I & II between September 15 and April 15, 2016 will be attributable to Phase II. The General Contractor is obtaining competitive pricing for portions of the work associated with Phase II. Activities associated with this additional bid process were not anticipated in N&T’s original fee but are included in this Amendment #2. The bid process started August 25, 2015 and is anticipated to conclude with Board approval of the GMP on Oct. 5, 2015. Closeout efforts are included in this request. This work is T&M, NTE to value presented in this Change #2.
	 
Submitted by:
Steve Kitchen, Executive Director, Facilities and Operations
Additional contact names:
Donna Jones Dulin, Associate Vice President - College Operations
Tom Armstrong, Director - Bond Program Management at De Anza College
					Steve Kitchen, Executive Director - Facilities and Operations
Is backup provided?
Yes

items.item_details:
Background and Analysis: 
	 
This revision is required to implement Bond list changes that are needed to adjust and prioritize approved project scopes and funding at Foothill and De Anza College.  
	 
Foothill Budget Transfer #53 includes the following actions:
Transfer project savings in the amount of $869.92 from Project 106, Modernization of Building 5700 to Project 199, Foothill Contingency to add funds to the project. Project 106 is financially complete.
Transfer $111.450.75 3rd quarter actual and 4th quarter accrued FY 2014/2015 interest earned revenue to Project 199, Foothill Contingency.
Note that current budget for Project 199, Foothill Contingency will have an additional funding source of  $140,281.54 due to PG&E Rebates (Checks 58-60 Series 1 and Checks 40-42 Series 2) not shown here.
Note that previously reported allocation to project 100 (100P), Scheduled Maintenance in the amount of $41,280 did not happen. The 100P project budget is $174,436.30.
Note that the actual amount of  FY 14-15 State Block Grant, Revision 2 (Scheduled Maintenance), recognized by Project 105, Modernization of Learning Center, Biology and General is $587,438 not $400,000 as it was reported before, not shown here.
Note that the actual amount of  FY 14-15 State Block Grant, Revision 2 (Scheduled Maintenance), recognized by Project 174, Fire Alarm System Replacement is $337,510 not $300,000 as it was reported before, not shown here.
De Anza  Budget Transfer #50 includes the following actions:
Transfer savings of $12,513.19 from Project 245, ATC to Project 229, Environmental Studies Area to add funds to the project. Project 245 is financially complete.
Transfer project savings of $247.34 from Project 274, Combined Site Improvements and $942.22 from project 245, ATC to Project 276, Campus Exterior Lighting Phase III to create a new project. Project 274 is financially complete.
Transfer project budget in the amount of $185,798 from Project 275, L-7 Phase II to Project 202, L-7 for continuity of work. 
Transfer $214,000 from Project 299, De Anza Contingency to Project 225, Campus Wide Electronic Locks to add funds to the project.
Transfer $80,000 from Project 206, Stadium and Track to Project 225, Campus Wide Electronic Locks to add funds to the project.
Transfer $839,780.55 from Project 200 (200P), Scheduled Maintenance to Project 236 (236G), Repair Tile Roofs to create a new 236G Sub-project, Reroof at Campus Center. 
Transfer $111,450.75 3rd quarter actual and 4th quarter accrued FY 2014/2015 interest earned revenue to Project 225, Campus Wide Electronic Locks to add funds to the project.
Note that current budget for Project 251 (251C), Install Photovoltaics will have an additional funding source of $107,484.37 due to PG&E Rebates (Checks 59-60 Series 1 and Checks 37-39 Series 2) not shown here.
On 2/9/2015 Board approved $527,099 allocation of FY 14-15 State Block Grant to project 216, Library. The actual encumbered amount to this project is $634,000 and is not shown here. Revision #2 of FY 14-15 State Block Grant (Scheduled Maintenance) communicated this change to the State.
On 2/9/2015 Board approved $634,000 allocation of FY 14-15 State Block Grant to project 202, L-7. The actual encumbered amount to this project is $671,570 and is not shown here. Revision #2 of FY 14-15 State Block Grant (Scheduled Maintenance) communicated this change to the State.
Submitted by:
Steve Kitchen, Executive Director, Facilities and Operations
Additional contact names:
Bernata Slater, Art Heinrich, Tom Armstrong and Donna Jones-Dulin
Is backup provided?
Yes
items.item_recommendation: Steve Kitchen, Executive Director of Facilities and Operations, recommends that the Board approve the Bond Project List Revision with Foothill Budget Transfer #53 and De Anza Budget Transfer #50.
